title: Business Live: Wall Street slides - BBC News
summary: uk car sales down sharply in november .
cineworld to buy us cinema chain regal .
uk rail fares to rise by 3.4 % in 2018 .

documents.title: good night !
text: that 's it for this evening .
thanks for reading and do join us again tomorrow from 06:00 .

documents.title: time for regional stock markets ?
text: we leave you tonight with this thought from business live reader greg hart of inverness .
he thinks there should be stock exchanges in glasgow or edinburgh , as well as england 's big cities :
as a graduate of business living in scotland , the majority of business money appears to not come from private entrepreneurship but from the scottish executive public sector .
as a follower of the ftse 250 stock market , i wonder whether it is possible that scotland could have its own stock market .
we have here , oil , whisky and tourism as well as developed law and banking sectors , however the stock market registrations are in london .
with the above sectors moving their registrations to glasgow or edinburgh , this would help the prosperity of scotland and keep employment within scotland .
in england regional markets could be developed in birmingham , manchester and newcastle - providing competition in great britain for london post brexit .
healthy competition would be a positive influence for prosperity

documents.title: new york falls
text: wall street ended lower as a technology rebound lost steam and walt disney co dipped , while investors assessed how a republican tax overhaul would impact corporate earnings .
the dow jones industrial average fell 0.45 % to 24,180 points , the s & p 500 was down 0.4 % to 2,629.5 and the nasdaq composite dropped 0.2 % to 6,762 .
the s & p fell for a third straight session - a losing streak not seen since early august .

documents.title: breakingboss of poundland owner resigns
text: steinhoff international , the company that owns retail chains poundland , harveys and bensons for beds in the uk , has `` accepted the resignation '' of chief executive markus jooste following an investigation into accounting irregularities .
chairman christo wiese has been appointed executive chairman on an interim basis .
`` shareholders and other investors in steinhoff are advised to exercise caution when dealing in securities of the group , '' the frankfurt-listed company warned tonight .
pwc has been asked to carry out an independent investigation .

documents.title: one for the football geeks
text: adidas is winning the battle of footballers ' shirts - but nike is fighting back
it is what they deserve for designing great looking jerseys !
but nike team will lift the cup .
since nike owns umbro , is umbro included in the tally ?

documents.title: disney 'leads fox race '
text: disney is the frontrunner to buy most of twenty-first century fox , although nbc owner comcast remains in contention , reuters reports .
the murdoch family , which controls fox , prefers a deal with disney because it would rather be paid in disney shares than comcast , according to people familiar with the matter .
they also expect a potential deal with disney to be cleared by us regulators more easily , one source told reuters .
however , no deal between disney and fox is imminent and several issues have yet to be fully negotiated , the sources added .
fox and comcast declined to comment , while disney did not immediately respond to requests for comment .

documents.title: brighthouse responds to 'media storm '
text: the chief executive of controversial rent-to-buy retailer brighthouse has spoken at length for the first time about the `` blistering '' media coverage it 's received in recent months .
the company was told to repay £ 15m to customers in october after financial regulators found it had not acted as a `` responsible lender '' .
weeks later it was caught up in another storm when it was revealed that the queen held a small stake in the company .
`` this time the media coverage was blistering and we were in the eye of the perfect storm , '' brighthouse boss hamish paton writes in retail week .
mr paton goes on to say : `` yes , it 's possible to buy a washing machine or a television for less if you have access to the cash .
but our customers ca n't because they do n't . ''
he concedes the firm `` have n't always got it right '' , but says its customers are `` very thankful brighthouse is there '' for helping them afford the things they need .

documents.title: what makes a tax haven ?
text: when is a tax haven not a tax haven ?
we find out in the global @ twitterid podcast with @ twitterid @ twitterid why are there no european jurisdictions on the eu 's new tax haven blacklist ?

documents.title: 'worst is over for snapchat '
text: snapchat owner snap is still topping the leaderboard on wall street , rising nearly 10 % to $ 14.92 a share - after a barclays analyst suggested the company 's future looks a lot brighter next year .
snap shares are down 40 % this year , after facing rising competition from facebook and investor scrutiny over its struggles to turn a profit .
but barclays analyst ross sandler says that instead of the narrative being that `` facebook is killing snap '' , people will start realising that fb-snap can co-exist like rivals .
`` in short , we think the worst is behind snap and the company is likely to get back on track in 2018 , '' he says .

documents.title: james murdoch to lead disney ?
text: this would be an interesting outcome if disney ends up buying most of 21st century fox from rupert murdoch .

the financial times is reporting that his younger son , james murdoch ( right ) , is likely to take a senior executive role at disney if it completes a takeover of fox 's movie studio , cable channels , international units .
james murdoch is chief executive of fox and chairman of sky .

he has been suggested as a potential successor to bob iger , chief executive of walt disney , in deal discussions over the sale of fox 's entertainment assets , the ft said , citing unnamed people briefed on the talks .

documents.title: cryptokitties anyone ?
text: sticking with crypto-currencies , the bbc tech team is reporting on the unexpected fallout from a new craze for virtual kittens .
cryptokitties lets players buy and breed `` crypto-pets '' by using ethereum , one of the largest crypto-currencies .
the popularity of the critters has seen pending transactions in ethereum increase sixfold - but it 's also slowing down trade in the digital currency as it struggles to cope .

documents.title: answers on a postcard
text: would you put your money into bitcoins and other cryptocurrencies ?
e-mail moneybox @ bbc.co.uk
that ship has sailed and the power behind the throne - tether ltd - is a non regulated company i would n't go anywhere near .
bubble time .
i 'm more than 400 % up and treating it as a gamble .
happy to discuss
only if you 've run out of water droplets drifting down a window to bet between
no , what is is supported and backed up by , minerals , resources , oil ?
i 'll try my best to shoot you guys an email over this evening

documents.title: check the grey list too
text: as reported earlier , the european union has published its first blacklist of tax havens , naming 17 territories including south korea , barbados and bahrain .
but it 's also released a further `` grey '' list of 47 countries , which have been given to the end of next year to reform their tax systems .
that second list features the cayman islands , vanuatu , guernsey , jersey , bermuda ( and the isle of man - the last two featuring prominently in last month 's paradise papers leak .
oli pearce , oxfam 's inequality and tax policy advisor , said : `` a place on the grey list must not mean tax havens get off scot-free . ''

documents.title: snap !
text: technology stocks are the main winners on wall street as we head into the final couple of hours of trading .
the s & p tech index is up about 0.7 % led by gains in microsoft , amazon and facebook .
shares in the three firms are each about 1 % higher after a sell-off in tech stocks over the last two days .
snapchat is also riding high - gaining nearly 10 % after analysts at barclays predicted the messaging app would beat expectations next year .

documents.title: brexit deal 'a big shock '
text: the leader of northern ireland 's dup has lifted the lid on what happened yesterday to scupper chances of the uk and eu moving onto the next round of brexit talks .
arlene foster said the deal the uk government was set to agree with the european union came as `` a big shock '' to the party .
talks in brussels were blown off course because the dup , which props up theresa may 's government , rejected a proposal about the future of the irish border .
mrs foster said the dup saw the text of the deal on monday morning , despite asking to see it for five weeks .
`` once we saw the text , we knew it was not going to be acceptable , '' she told republic of ireland national broadcaster rté .

documents.title: panama rejects eu blacklist
text: that did n't take long .
panama has reacted angrily to its inclusion on a new european union blacklist of tax havens .
`` i reject the arbitrary and discriminatory inclusion of panama on the european union tax haven lists , '' economy and finance minister dulcidio de la guardia said on twitter .
eu finance ministers earlier named 17 countries which are deemed `` non-cooperative tax jurisdictions '' - which included panama , south korea and the united arab emirates .
the huge leak last year of financial documents from panamanian law firm mossack fonseca - dubbed the `` panama papers '' - put the island 's tax laws under intense scrutiny .
rechazo la inclusión arbitraria y discriminatoria de panamá en la listas de paraísos fiscales de la unión europea .

documents.title: how much is the uk worth ?
text: you might not have noticed , but the uk has become more valuable .
that 's according to data from the office for national statistics .
the total net worth of the uk economy at the end of 2016 is estimated at £ 9.8 trillion , an increase of £ 803bn from 2015 and the largest annual rise on record , the ons said .
land is the most valuable asset in the uk , accounting for just over half of the total net worth .
the value of land has grown rapidly from 1995 , increasing by 412 % compared with an average increase of 211 % in the assets which sit on the land .

documents.title: mueller paves way for possible showdown
text: deutsche bank was a lifeline for the trump organisation 's businesses in the early 2000s , when us lenders turned their backs on the then-struggling business tycoon .
how closely did mr trump and his associates follow the letter of the law at a time before he was a serious political candidate ?

the president 's defenders will argue that his past business dealings are not relevant to the special counsel inquiry , tasked with probing possible ties between the trump campaign and russia during the 2016 presidential election .
a high-stakes showdown over whether mr mueller is exceeding his mandate could be brewing .
author: Anthony Zurcher
BBC North America reporter

documents.title: trump probe 'demands deutsche bank data '
text: as we reported earlier , us special counsel robert mueller is said to have asked deutsche bank to provide records of accounts held by donald trump .
we now have a piece on the bbc website with the full details of this story .
the subpoena on deutsche is part of mueller 's investigation into alleged russian influence in the us presidential election
the german bank , which is one of the trump organisation 's major lenders on its real estate projects , has said it will not comment on any of its clients .
in a statement to bloomberg , deutsche added that it `` always cooperates with investigating authorities in all countries '' .

documents.title: swish swish
text: katy perry and the catholic church have been awarded almost $ 10m ( £ 7.5m ) in damages after the star 's plans to buy a former la convent ended up in court .
perry agreed to purchase the hilltop property for $ 14.5m ( £ 10.8m ) in 2015 .
but two of the nuns who used to live there objected , and instead sold it to restaurateur dana hollister without the approval of the archdiocese .
last month , a jury found hollister intentionally interfered with perry 's planned purchase .

documents.title: scores on the doors
text: tesco finished top of leaderboard on the uk 's ftse 100 share index , rising 3 % to 201 pence .
analysts at goldman sachs said there were signs that supermarkets ' wafer-thin profit margins were improving ; and that tesco was taking market share .
sainsbury 's rose 2.8 % to 239 pence and morrisons finished 2.2 % higher at 219 pence .
on the ftse 250 index , the biggest faller was door-to-door lender provident financial after it revealed uk financial regulators are investigating its moneybarn car finance unit .
provident 's shares finished 10 % lower , having fallen almost 70 percent since june amid profit warnings and the resignation of its chief executive .

documents.title: ftse loses steam
text: the uk 's 100 share index has finished lower after losing momentum in afternoon trading .
it 's dropped by 11 points , or 0.2 % , to 7,327.50 .
mining stocks provided the biggest drag , with glencore and anglo american falling by more than 2 % .
they were hurt by drops in metal prices , as copper and nickel hit their lowest levels in two months .

documents.title: vauxhall skids
text: the uk car industry is on course for its first annual decline since 2011 - with new car sales down 5 % in the year so far , according to industry figures out earlier .
the worst hit of the big manufacturers is vauxhall , which has suffered a 22 % decline in new car registrations over the period , the smmt data indicates .
a sign of the problems facing vauxhall came in october when it announced 400 job cuts at its ellesmere port car plant due to falling sales .
peugeot and citroen , which are part of the psa group that bought vauxhall this year , have seen new car sales fall 16 % and 18 % respectively .
ford - which still has two of the best-selling cars in the fiesta and focus - has seen a 9 % drop .

documents.title: powell powers on
text: jerome powell , who is donald trump 's to take over as head of the us central bank , has taken a step closer to the most powerful job in economics .
the us senate banking committee voted 22-1 to approve his nomination as federal reserve chair .
it now goes to the full senate for a vote .
the lawyer and multi-millionaire investment banker has served on the fed 's board of governors since 2012 .

documents.title: japan airlines goes boom
text: japan airlines has invested £ 10m in boom , the us firm that wants to build a supersonic passenger jet .
the denver-based start-up , which has been backed by the likes of sir richard branson , is in the process of developing the world 's first commercially viable supersonic aircraft .
the deal with jal will help boom refine the aircraft 's design and give it the option to buy up to 20 boom planes .
boom aims to be carrying passengers on its planes by the beginning of the next decade , halving flight times in the process .
a flight from san francisco to tokyo that takes 11 hours today could take less than five and a half on one of its aircraft flying at mach 2.2 .
here 's boom boss blake scholl speaking to the bbc at the paris air show in june :
author: Chris Johnston
Business reporter, BBC News

documents.title: scottish car sales stall
text: scots new car registrations in nov : -24 % on nov 16 diesel -41 % !
@ smmt

author: Douglas Fraser
Scotland business & economy editor

documents.title: eu names and shames 17 countries
text: european union finance ministers have adopted a list of 17 countries deemed as tax havens .
the eu 's tax commissioner , pierre moscovici , called it a `` first step '' for tackling tax evasion - although the ministers did not agree on financial levies for the listed countries .
here is the list :

eu list of non-cooperative tax jurisdictions : american samoa bahrain barbados grenada guam korea ( republic of ) macao sar marshall islands mongolia namibia palau panama saint lucia samoa trinidad and tobago tunisia united arab emirates # taxhavens # blacklist
and 47 tax jurisdictions have committed to address problems in their tax systems .

documents.title: 'i ca n't believe there 'll be no deal '
text: `` after all those irish border skirmishes , here 's some better news on brexit .
`` the bundesbank - the german equivalent of the bank of england - is optimistic that a free trade agreement between the uk and the european union can be achieved .
`` indeed , one of their most senior executives , andreas dombret ( told the bbc he ' can not believe ' there will be no deal - although it was n't a 'zero possibility ' . ''
read more from kamal here .
author: Kamal Ahmed
Economics editor

documents.title: tech stocks rebound
text: amazon , microsoft , facebook and other major us technology shares are among the winners at the start of trading on wall street - with all three firms rising by more than 1 % .
their gains are pushing the tech-heavy nasdaq index higher - rising 0.6 % to 6,816 - after the sector took a hit on monday .
investors had sold off tech stocks to invest in banks and other firms expected to gain more from donald trump 's planned corporate tax cuts .
the other us indexes are largely flat in early trading .
the dow jones is down 0.02 % at 24,284 points and the s & p 500 is up 0.01 % at 2,640 .

documents.title: why irish border remains a sticking point
text: reality check explains the knotty issue of cross-border trade , security checks and regulations between northern ireland and the republic of ireland .
over the summer , brexit negotiators identified more than 140 areas of `` north-south co-operation '' that would be affected by brexit in one way or another .
in a nutshell , if northern ireland , along with the rest of the uk , starts changing its regulations after brexit , then problems start to arise .
read more here .

documents.title: first fall in november car sales since 2011
text: as we reported earlier , the latest figures on new car sales make for grim reading for the industry .
new car registrations dropped 11 % in november , the eighth month of decline this year - with diesels down a whopping 30 % .
uk new car demand falls -11.2 % in november to 163,541 units
what time will ev registrations be published ?
you can find them here tom
thanks , i 'd been refreshing this page instead !
great news as we move into ev 's and less personal car ownership

documents.title: uk pension 'lags rest of the world '
text: the uk 's state pension is one of the least generous among the most advanced economies in the world , according to a new report .
the average pensioner can expect to receive just 29 % of what they earned at work , the organisation of economic co-operation and development ( oecd ) says .
only mexico , south africa and indonesia are less generous .
however , once `` voluntary '' pensions - such as auto enrolment or workplace pensions - are taken into account , the uk fares better in comparison .
read more here .

documents.title: good afternoon
text: thanks ben and dearbail for taking us through the morning .
i 'm here for the afternoon , bringing you the latest news from the markets and the world of business .
it 's a supermarket sweep on the ftse 100 - with investors grabbing shares in tesco , sainsbury 's and morrisons after analysts suggested their profit margins will improve .
the pound has pared its losses slightly against the dollar and euro and is now back above $ 1.34 and €1.13 respectively .
do get in touch if the mood takes you .
i 'm on bizlivepage @ bbc.co.uk .
author: Dan Macadam
BBC business reporter

documents.title: give trump a chance , says ma
text: jack ma , the billionaire chairman of chinese internet giant alibaba , says that americans need to give us president donald trump a chance because he has n't been in the white house for that long .
he told cnbc : `` you may not agree with him . ''
but he said : `` you can never achieve something within one year . ''
he said : `` at least he 's trying . ''

documents.title: oil prices head lower
text: oil prices are down after a brief rise in early trading .
brent crude is off 0.4 % at $ 62.23 a barrel while west texas intermediate is down 0.6 % at $ 57.10 .
some analysts said that investors were profit taking after opec members and other oil producing nations led by russia agreed at a meeting last week to limit supplies until the end of 2018 .
carsten fritsch , analyst at commerzbank , says : `` oil prices are continuing to crumble .
`` we attribute the price slide to profit taking by speculative investors , who were holding almost record-high net long positions ahead of opec 's meeting . ''

documents.title: european press sees may on 'razor edge '
text: european press sees may on 'razor edge '

documents.title: when the chips are down
text: the chart above shows what happens to a firm 's share price when its best customer decides it does not need them as much anymore .
dialog semiconductor , based in reading , makes power management chips and counts apple as one of its big clients .
but yesterday dialog confirmed reports - which first surfaced last month - that apple was going to start making one of those chips itself .
dialog shares have fallen by nearly a half since that news emerged - although dialog will still be providing 11 other types of chips for apple .
however , that 's made dialog attractive to some buyers .
china 's state-backed chip firm tsinghua unigroup has increased its stake in dialog to 7.15 % - helping to give dialog 's shares a lift today .

documents.title: ireland forced to collect apple 's back taxes
text: ireland is to comply with a european commission order to collect a disputed €13bn tax bill from the us firm apple .
the money is now being paid into a blocked `` escrow '' account , while ireland appeals the commission 's decision .
the commission ruled last year that ireland had given apple illegal state aid by allowing it to pay an effective 1 % corporation tax .
read more here .

documents.title: mueller 'subpoenas deutsche bank ' in russia probe
text: robert mueller , the special counsel who is heading an investigation into alleged russian interference in the us election , has subpoenaed deutsche bank to produce documents on its links with donald trump and his family , according to bloomberg .
mr trump has a long-standing relationship with germany 's largest bank and owed the lender $ 300m for real estate deals that took place before he became president .
in a comment to bloomberg , it said : `` deutsche bank always cooperates with investigating authorities in all countries . ''

documents.title: ftse 100 drifts lower as miners fall
text: some of the steam has gone out of the ftse 100 this morning .
it 's trading just 13 points higher at 7,349 .
the big mining firms are weighing on the index .
glencore is down 2 % , anglo american is 1.3 % lower and rio tinto is more than 1 % lower .
those shares have been hurt by falling prices for metals .
supermarkets continue to be the big winners , after goldman sachs said that profit margins should start improving .

documents.title: empty supermarket shelves explained
text: last week the giant uk wholesaler , palmer and harvey went into administration .
that is leaving some supermarket shelves looking a little sparse , according to independent retail analyst steve dresser .
frozen bake off lines hard hit in tesco express today .
delivered in by p & h
core frozen was also delivered by p & h gaps opening up here without deliveries

the business was closed so quickly it makes you wonder if depot stocks were reduced accordingly or just left .

documents.title: how is your rail fare spent ?
text: how is your rail fare spent ?

documents.title: spotting your workplace rival
text: do you have a work rival ?
many of us do .
but while we can easily name our favourite colleagues , it 's more difficult to decipher who might be secretly vying to push you aside .
in many cases , we may not even know we have a work rival , experts say .
and when it comes to handling a nemesis , there are a host of mistakes that employees are making , according to new research .
read more here .

documents.title: have your say : too young for facebook ?
text: # facebook launches messenger kids for users under 13 yrs , it 's said to be a safe space with greater parental control .
what do you think ?
how young is too young for social media ?
comments to # bbcbizlive
totally against it !
absolutely not !
bad bad bad idea .
so many parents are wary about this .
they 're worried about the consequences .
we 're building @ twitterid for those who are looking for an alternative to mainstream social networks .
no ads .
no data-selling .
i 'd love to hear your thoughts on it
hey , facebook , leave those kids alone !
any pink floyd quote gets my vote but seriously , i hear you - creating a safe space for children and their families is a must .
that 's what we 're looking to build with @ twitterid i 'd love to hear your thoughts on it
no just no and in case i was n't clear ; no no no !
social media should n't play a part of youngsters lives at this rate , people will barely leave their homes in the future to socialise , shop and exercise .

i do n't agree with this mainly either , considering the amounts of stuff that actually gets put on facebook , once something is posted , it is out there for everyone to see think of the consequences it will bring .
yurp !
i hear you .
i 've done 100s of interviews with families who are wary of the impact and the long term consequences .
it 's why we 're creating kindaba - no ads .
no data-selling .
a safe , private space for your family .
i 'd love to hear your thoughts on it
this just announces to predators where they can easily find potential targets .
predators are good at blending in and acting a part so they can gain a child 's trust .
kids need to be kids first .
plenty of time later to engae in # socialmedia .
even teens ca n't emtionally handle it !
this is more criminal activity .
remember philip morris- where do we get new users to addict ?
its 3 years before they can even text and drive .
what could go wrong ?
is not encouraged at all especially in child moral upbringing .
18 is a good age .
anything else is too young imho
way too young .
perverts will find a way to abuse it .
it should not be used .
# bbcbizlive
@ twitterid can not even keep adults safe , and they think parents should responsibly trust them with their kids .
they need to demonstrate competence before doing this .
my kid ?
no way is she going to be on facebook with an inflated sense of safety amongst child predators .

alot of adults do the same thing and a study has shown that most kids develop a love for their phones because from a young age when they are trying to get their parents attention but they ca n't cos they are glued to their phones children then begin to realise that they 're not
that 's certainly a challenge.supporting children to be resilient online while encouraging face-face interaction and family time .
it 's why we 're creating kindaba - a safe , private space for your family .
i 'd love to hear your thoughts on it
it seems too early to me , children under 13 should learn how to communicate in person first
facebook for kids is danger , may ruin them due to access to porn & beyond imagination & control .
rather a tv shows is best on moral science .

documents.title: tencent drags hong kong lower
text: tencent dragged hong kong 's market lower as tech shares faltered around the region .
the chinese internet giant behind the game king of glory ( sank 3.2 % , while index heavyweight softbank eased back 0.7 % in japan .
the hang seng index closed 1 % lower , down 295.48 points , at 28,842.80 , while japan 's nikkei 225 index shed 0.4 % , or 84.78 points , to end at 22,622.38 .

documents.title: uk tops european rail prices
text: train travel in the uk is the highest in europe , according to vouchercloud .
the company compared the price per mile of a single train journey from each country 's capital city to the train station closest to 50 miles away .
this data was complied before this latest price rise for train tickets was announced , so the gap between the uk and others could grow .

documents.title: services optimism good but not great
text: commenting on the services sector data , duncan brock , director of customer relationships at the chartered institute of procurement & supply , said : `` businesses could no longer fight against the tide of higher prices for food , fuel and salaries as input cost inflation remained close to its strongest for six years , and businesses passed these increases on to consumers at the fastest rate since february 2008 . ''
he said that while optimism for the future was sustained and improved slightly `` this is nothing to write home about '' .
`` though any uplift in sentiment is always welcomed , the levels of confidence were far from those seen during the highs of 2013-2016 . ''

documents.title: 'inflation yet to peak '
text: chris williamson , chief business economist at ihs markit , said that despite disappointing growth in services last month : `` the latest survey data indicate that the economy is on course to enjoy robust growth in the fourth quarter . ''

however , he said the `` big news '' in november 's figures is prices which showed `` the largest monthly increase in average prices charged for goods and services since august 2008 ; a time when oil prices soared just before the global financial crisis '' .

he said higher oil prices were also to blame for this latest increase : `` with firms also reporting the need to pass higher costs of a wide variety of other inputs on to customers as a result of the weak pound having driven up import prices . ''
`` as such , the survey data suggest that inflationary pressures have yet to peak . ''

documents.title: slower services growth is 'a setback '
text: ihs markit , which compiles the services sector survey , says that the november data `` pointed to a setback '' .
it said that volumes of new work rose at a slower pace while the rate of staff hiring had also eased .
it said : `` service providers ' optimism regarding the year ahead outlook for business activity up slightly in november , but remained weaker than the trend seen through the first half of 2017 . ''

documents.title: pound on the move
text: before that service sector data came out the pound had slid below $ 1.34 .
but that weaker than expected report gave the pound a bit of a lift adding about a third of a cent to $ 1.3410 .
it 's still down about half a cent on monday 's close .

documents.title: breakinguk services ease in november
text: activity in the uk 's services sector hit 53.8 in november , down from 55.6 in the previous month , according to the markit/cips purchasing managers ' index .
analysts were expecting activity to accelerate .

documents.title: sterling searches for boost from services
text: the pound is now trading 0.65 % lower on the dollar at $ 1.33920 .

connor campbell , financial analyst at spreadex , says traders will be looking towards the purchasing managers ' index ( pmi ) on how the services sector performed in november , due out at 9.30am , to give sterling a lift .
he says : `` so far november 's pmis have looked mighty strong , with the manufacturing reading at a 4 year high and the construction figure easily beating expectations .
`` analysts are forecasting the services number to come in at 55.2 against october 's 55.6 though , as mentioned , such estimates have n't been very accurate in the last few days . ''

documents.title: mixed reviews for cineworld
text: cineworld should be able to make cost savings of $ 100m per year , after the purchase of us cinema chain regal , according to a research note from stockbroker peel hunt .
that could boost earnings by around 30 % the note said .
but peel hunt does raise some warning flags , in particular its plan to sell shares to finance the deal ( equity raising ) :
`` the long-term investment proposition has fundamentally changed as a result of higher debt and earnings becoming heavily dominated by mature markets .
in the short term , we would expect the scale of the equity raise to cause indigestion , '' the report said .

documents.title: diesel 'confusion ' hits car sales
text: new car demand fell by 11.2 % in november , according to the society of motor manufacturers and traders , which it blamed on confusion over the future of diesel vehicles .
new registrations for diesel vehicles fell by 30.6 % .

smmt chief executive mike hawes says : `` an eighth month of decline in the new car market is a major concern , with falling business and consumer confidence exacerbated by ongoing anti-diesel messages from government . ''

documents.title: supermarket shares head higher
text: the top three winners on the ftse 100 are morrison supermarkets ( up 3.7 % ) , tesco ( up 3.5 % ) and sainsbury 's ( up 2.3 % ) .
those shares have been helped by postive comments from analysts at goldman sachs .
the bank says the pressure on profit margins is easing in the uk grocery market .
in particular it is excited about the prospects for tesco , which it notes is taking market share .
goldman has upgraded its view on tesco shares from sell to buy .

documents.title: rail fare rise biggest for five years
text: how does the rise in rail fares , due to come into force in january 2018 , compare to previous years ?

documents.title: outlook 'uncertain ' for provident financial
text: the financial conduct authority ( fca ) is investigating moneybarn , part of provident financial .
neil wilson senior market analyst at etx capital reacts to that news :

`` the fca only authorised moneybarn last june and it 's worth noting that this is by no means a large part of provident 's overall business with only around 50k customers out of the group 's 2 million .
but it adds to the woes for the embattled lender and is another headache for management at the worst time .
`` provident is already facing an fca investigation into the repayment option plan ( rop ) ancillary product offered by its vanquis bank subsidiary .
`` shares have rallied firmly from the august collapse , but today 's update is another red flag for investors .
`` ultimately , with a healthy cash pile , new management and a turnaround strategy in place , provident can weather regulatory storms such as these .
`` the real question is whether it can get its core doorstep lending business back in shape .
on that front the outlook is very uncertain . ''

documents.title: markets : cineworld down ; provident financial plunges
text: cineworld shares have fallen more than 1 % after it announced a deal to buy us cinema chain regal .
back on 29 november , when reports of the deal first emerged , cineworld shares tumbled almost 20 % .
cineworld is listed on the ftse 250 and overall that index is up a bit so far .
but the big mover on that index is provident financial , shares are down 15 % after the financial conduct authority announced an investigation into its moneybarn unit .
the ftse 100 is 0.4 % higher in the early going .

documents.title: pound falls on dup 's brexit backlash
text: the pound is down 0.51 % on the dollar $ 1.34110 following the government 's failure to strike a deal with eu following backlash from the dup over the status of the irish border after brexit .
sterling has also fallen on the euro , down 0.43 % at €1.13100 .

documents.title: rail rise 'twists the economic knife '
text: the rail , maritime and transport union says the 3.4 % rise in rail fares is `` another kick in the teeth '' for passengers .

its general secretary mick cash says : `` for public sector workers and many others in our communities who have had their pay and benefits capped or frozen by this government , these fare increases are another twist of the economic knife .
`` the private train companies are laughing all the way to the bank . ''

documents.title: chill wind brings ill news for travellers
text: the rise in rail fares is the highest since 2013 , when they increased by 3.9 % .
passenger watchdog transport focus compared the jump to `` a chill wind '' blowing down platforms as many households contend with stagnating wages .

its chief executive anthony smith says : `` while substantial , welcome investment in new trains and improved track and signals is continuing , passengers are still seeing the basic promises made by the rail industry broken on too many days . ''

documents.title: rail fare rise is 'significant '
text: paul plummer , chief executive of the rail delivery group , an umbrella group that includes the uk 's train operators and network rail , admits that the rise in rail fares is a `` significant increase '' .

he tells the bbc 's today programme : `` we 're very aware of the pressures on people and the state of the economy so that 's why we 're making sure that everything we do in partnership across the industry is looking to improve and change and make best use of that money . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: rail network 'buckling ' under the strain
text: you might think that popularity is a good thing , but it 's causing the railways some problems .
here 's some examples .
passenger numbers on routes into king 's cross have rocketed by 70 % in the past 14 years .
on southern trains , passenger numbers coming into london have doubled in twelve years .
that 's got to be good for easing congestion and reducing vehicle pollution , but much of our rail network is still victorian and it 's buckling under the strain of all those extra people .
there is a push to bring in new trains , stations and better lines , but it 's difficult to upgrade things whilst keeping them open , and it 's seriously expensive .
the money 's got to come from somewhere and in recent years it 's the fare payer that 's been asked to up a bigger proportion of the tab .
it means that , year in and year out , many people have seen their season ticket go up much more than their salary , if they 've had a salary rise at all .
author: Richard Westcott
Transport correspondent

documents.title: breakingblockbuster deal in movie business
text: cineworld has agreed to buy us cinema chain regal for $ 3.6bn ( £ 2.7bn ) .
combined the two firms will have more than 9,500 screens in the us and europe which would make it the world 's second biggest cinema operator .
cineworld plans to sell shares and take on more debt to fund the deal .
but is says takeover will not affect its dividend plans .

documents.title: trump tax plans could boost big uk firms
text: us president donald trump 's tax reforms are good news for uk businesses , says laura foll , fund manager at janus henderson .
`` the difference it makes for uk companies is that a large number , particularly of the ftse 100 , are very international companies .
`` therefore if they have us earnings and their blended tax rate goes down - if the corporation tax rate does go down from 35 % to 20 % - that will be positive for a large number of uk companies . ''
she adds : `` it also could be positive for the us dollar and therefore those that have us earnings will see a translational boost if the us dollar does go higher once this gets through . ''

documents.title: moneybarn under investigation
text: moneybarn is under investigation by the financial conduct authority ( fca ) .
moneybarn specialises in loans for cars and vans to customers with poor credit records .
it is part of provident financial .
the fca is looking into the way moneybarn assesses loan applications and the treatment of customers in financial difficulties .
moneybarn says it will work `` collaboratively '' with the fca to investigate its concerns .

documents.title: irish border : business wants co-operation
text: what does regulatory equivalence actually mean ?
`` well , that 's the million dollar questions , '' says kirsty mcmanus , national director in northern ireland for the institute of directors .
it is a sticking point for the dup which objected to a clause in a draft agreement with the eu that would guarantee `` regulatory alignment '' between northern ireland and the republic .
ms mcmanus says : `` what we would say is regulatory co-operation .
`` there has been a long-stranding history of co-operation on both islands under the good friday agreement .
`` enshrined in that is that all-ireland economy . ''
she points to the single electricity market where northern ireland shares a wholesale electricity market with the republic of ireland .
`` so that basis of co-operation exists .
let 's maintain that and lets get moved on to phase two where we talk aboireland ut the trade negotiations . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: pound watching brexit talks
text: the pound gyrated on monday , first rising on hopes of progress in brexit talks and then falling back after theresa may 's failed to secure an agreement over the border between northern ireland and the republic of ireland .

`` i think what 's happening is people are giving theresa may until the end of the week to see if they can reach some sort of agreement ahead of the summit next week , '' laura foll , fund manager at janus henderson .
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: breakingtrain fares to rise more than inflation
text: train fares will rise , on average , by 3.4 % from 2 january 2018 .
that 's above the rate of inflation - consumer price inflation is running at 3 % .
that announcement is from rail delivery group , which comprises all passenger and rail freight companies , plus network rail and hs2 .

documents.title: business pages : youtube ; bitcoin ; rbs
text: google has promised an `` army '' of 10,000 staff to find extremist content on youtube , according to the front page of the telegraph .
the team will also root out content that endangers children .
also from the telegrah - bitcoin could rival gold , says jp morgan .
the article points out that this is a slightly surprising view from the bank 's analysts , as the jp morgan chief executive jamie dimon has long been a critic of bitcoin .
the times reports that it has discovered why the financial conduct authority has refused to publish a highly critical report of royal bank of scotland .
it feared rbs would sue the fca over the report , which investigated the mishandling of thousand of small and medium sized companies .

documents.title: picking up the pieces
text: trevor lockhart , chief executive of fane valley , a farming co-operative that trades on both sides of the border in ireland , says that there is `` growing frustration '' with a lack of clarity over the status of the irish border when the uk leaves the eu .

he tells the bbc 's today programme : `` our sense this morning is one of growing frustration - growing frustration that as a long established business trading extensively with the republic of ireland and great britain that all these months on we are no clearer and no better able to answer the calls for clarification we 're getting from our staff , from our suppliers and our customers .
`` and those voices are growing louder as each month passes . ''
he says : `` clearly yesterday something went horribly wrong and this morning we 're trying to up the pieces . ''
author: Today Programme
BBC Radio 4

documents.title: starbucks ' biggest cafe to open in china
text: starbucks will open its biggest store in shanghai on wednesday , as the cafe chain ramps up operations in its fastest growing market .
the firm says it opens a new store in china every 15 hours and already has more than 600 stores in shanghai - the largest number of cafes in any city .
the 30,000 square feet roastery is about half the size of a football pitch and is the second such concept store after the first opened in the us .
starbucks is betting big on china to help kickstart sluggish global sales and sees the mainland market overtaking its home market within a decade .

documents.title: amazon launches in australia
text: us e-commerce giant amazon has launched in australia in time for christmas , posing a new threat to bricks and mortar retailers .
amazon 's australian marketplace is offering `` millions '' of products from well-known australian brands , covering 23 categories including books electronics and baby products .
offering one day deliveries in some areas , its entry into australia is likely to pile pressure on local online players like jb hi fi and ebay .
online shopping currently accounts for between 8 - 13 % of australia 's a $ 300bn ( £ 170bn ; $ 229bn ) retail market , leaving much room for growth .
but amazon could face its own challenges - including low access to broadband and the large size of the island continent .

documents.title: irish business worried about border talks
text: brexit talks stumbled yesterday over the issue of the border between northern ireland and the republic .
there are 200 crossing points on that border and 6,000 heavy goods vehicles cross every day , says pamela dennison from the chartered institute of logistics and transport in northern ireland .
if there was to be a hard border between northern ireland and the republic , then that would create real problems for irish business , she says .
for example , guiness is brewed in dublin , but bottled in belfast and exported .
potentially every cargo would be charged £ 50 for documents and there could be delays , she says .
ms dennison worries about fresh or perishable goods .
author: 5 Live

documents.title: uk car sales slide in november
text: new car registrations in the uk fell by 11 % in november , according to preliminary data from the society of motor manufacturers and traders .
that 's the 8th consecutive month of falling sales .
more data from the smmt comes at 09:00 gmt .

documents.title: good morning !
text: welcome to tuesday 's business live page .
there was another sharp decline in uk car sales in november .
staying with transport , we will find out how much average rail fares will go up in 2018 .
and we 'll be keeping an eye on the pound , as it reacts to political developments , or the lack of them , on brexit .
author: Ben Morris
Business reporter
